column1: Brunoy (French pronunciation: ​[bʁynwa]) is a commune in the south-eastern suburbs of Paris
column2: France. It is located 20.6 km (12.8 mi) from the center of Paris. The tenor Louis Nourrit (1780–1831) died in Brunoy.

column1: Inhabitants of Brunoy are known as Brunoyens.
The city has a church Saint-Medard
column2: richly decorated in the Louis XVI style. Organ Festival takes place each year in November.

column1: Brunoy is home to a branch of Yeshivas Tomchei Tmimim Lubavitch
column2: which attracts hundreds of students from around the world
column3: most notably from the United States of America and Israel.

column1: The town is twinned with the borough of Reigate and Banstead.
Brunoy is served by Brunoy station on Paris RER line D.
